availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph B. McClintock (Harrison County, Kentucky, sheriff and farmer)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, sheriff and farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Alexander McClintock and Ann M. McClintock. Married to Nancy G. Jameson McClintock in Bourbon County, Kentucky, on September 1, 1859. Father of Anna F. McClintock and James McClintock. Farmer in Nicholas County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Sheriff of Harrison County from 1863 to 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas, District 2, p. 409A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison, District 2, p. 461.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison, Cynthiana, p. 145B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bourbon County Marriages, Film #000216817, p 51.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Harrison County, KY, vol. 2 of 3, June and July 1863, p. 306.
"Joseph B. McClintock (1834-1891)," Find A Grave, Memorial #, 19427242, accessed November 15, 2019http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/19427242.
